intro: Eupatorium juninense, commonly known as the Junín feverfew, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom from late winter to early spring. Eupatorium juninense is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
